Charibert, a noble in Neustria ca 636, had issue:  A1. Chrodobertus=Robert, living 630 o B1. Lambert I, +after 650  C1. Chrodobertus=Robert II, Chancelor for King Clothar III, was made a count 678; m.Doda N  D1. Ct Lambert II, living 741  E1. Robert I, Duke in Haspengau, Ct in Oberrheinsgau and Wormsgau, living 764; m.ca 730 Williswint (+after 768) dau.of Ct Adalheim  F1. Robert Cancor, Ct in Breisgau, Oberrheinsgau, etc, +after 782; m.Angila N  G1. Ct Heimrich; +k.a.Lüne/Elbe 5.5.795; for his descendants see HERE  G2. Rachilt, a nun at Lorsch  G3. Euphemia, a nun at Lorsch  F2. Ct Anselm, +Ronceveaux 778  F3. Rupert, Abbot of St-Germain-des-Fosses, +after 779  F4. Thuringbert, +after 1.6.770  G1. Ct Robert II in Wormsgau and Oberrheinsgau, +12.7.807; 1m: Theoderata N; 2m: Isengarde N; for his descendants see HERE  A2. Albert  A3. Erlebert

Ct Robert II in Wormsgau and Oberrheinsgau, +12.7.807; 1m: Theoderata N; 2m: Isengarde N; He had issue:  A1. Ct Robert III in Wormsgau and Oberrheinsgau, +ca 834; m.ca 808 Wiltrud, dau.of Ct Hadrian of Orleans o B1. Ct Guntram, living 837 o B2. Robert I "le Fort", Cte de Paris, de Angers et de Tours, *820, +k.a.Brissarthe 15.9.866; 1m: Agane N; 2m: 864 Pss Adelaide of Franks (+after 866)/? dau.of Ct Hugo de Tours  C1. [1m.] a son, who inherited the family estates in Burgundy  C2. [1m.] Richildis, heiress of Blois; (?) m.Ct Theobald de Tours (+ca 942)  C3. [2m.] Odo (Eudes), Cte de Paris et de Aquitaine, King of France (888-898), *ca 865, +La Fere-sur-Oise I.898, bur St.Denis; m.ca 881 Theoderata de Troyes  D1. King Raoul of Aquitaine, *ca 882, living 898  D2. Arnulf, *ca 885, +898  D3. Guy, *ca 888, living 903  D4. [parentage not yet proven] Oda, *ca 883, +after 952; m.ca 897 King Zwentibold of Lorraine (+900)  C4. [2m.] Cte Robert I of Paris (892-893), King of France (922-923), *866, +k.a.nr Soissons 15.6.923; 1m: Aelis N (+before 931); 2m: ca 890 Beatrix de Vermandois (*880 +after III.931)  D1. [1m.] Hildebrante=Liegarde, *895, +931; m.before 907 Cte Heribert II de Vermandois (*884 +943)  D2. [1m.] Emma, *ca 894, +935; m.910 Raoul of Burgundy, King of France (+936)  D3. [2m.] Duke Hugues I of France, Cte de Paris, *Paris ca 895, +Deurden 16.6.956; 1m: 922 Judith N (+925); 2m: 926/7 Edhild of England (+937); 3m: 938 Hedwig of Saxony (*922 +10.5.965); for his issue see HERE o B3. Oda, m.Ct Walaho IV in Wormsgau

Heimrich, Count in Oberrheingau, had issue:  A1. Ct Robert, +ca 805 o B1. Ct Cancor, fl 812 o B2. Ct Robert, fl 817  A2. Ct Heinrich, fl 812; m.Hadaburg N o B1. Ct Poppo I in Saalgau  C1. Henri I, Duke of Austrasia, +k.a.Paris before 28.8.886, bur St.Medard at Soissons  D1. Ct Adalbert, +executed 9.6.906  D2. Ct Adalhard, +executed 903  D3. Ct Henri II, +k.a.902/3  E1. Ct Henri III, +ca 935  F1. Ct Henri IV, Archbp of Trier, +Rome 964  F2. Ct Berthold von Nordgau, +980; m.Eiliswinth von Walbeck  F3. Poppo de Austrasia, Bp of Würzburg, +II.961  E2. Hadui, +903; m.869/70 Duke Otto of Saxony (+912)  C2. Duke Poppo II of Sorbenmark, living 906  D1. Ct Adalbert of Grabfeld and Tullfeld, fl 915  D2. Ct Poppo III, +945 o B2. Ct Heimerich, +836

Duke HUGUES I of France, Cte de Paris, *Paris ca 895, +Deurden 16.6.956; 1m: 922 Judith N (+925); 2m: 926/7 Edhild of England (+26.1.937); 3m: Mainz 9.5./Ingelheim 14.9.938 Hedwig of Saxony (*922 +10.5.965). He had issue by his 3m.:  A1. HUGUES "Capet", Cte de Paris, Duc de France (956-987), King of France (987-996), *941, +Les Juifs nr Chartres 24.10.996, bur St.Denis; m.VI-VIII.968 Alice/Adela of Poitou (*950 +15.6.1006) /probably dau.of Duke William of Aquitaine by Adele of Normandy o B1. King ROBERT II "le Pieux" ("the Saint") of France (996-1031) cr 987, *Orleans 27.3.972, +Melun 20.7.1031, bur St.Denis; 1m: 988 (div 992) Rozela=Susana of Ivrea (*ca 950 +1003, bur Ghent); 2m: 997 (div 1003/5) Berthe des Deux-Bourgognes (+after 1017) dau.of King Rudolf III of Burgundy; 3m: 1003 Constance d'Arles (*ca 986, +25.7.1032)  C1. [2m.] a stillborn child, *and +999  C2. [3m.] Hugues III "le Grand", co-king cr 1017, *1007, +17.9.1026, bur St-Corneillier zt Compiegne  C3. [3m.] King HENRI I of France (1031-60) cr 1025, Duc de Bourgogne (ca 1017-60), *Reims IV.1008, +Vitry-en-Brie 4.8.1060, bur St.Denis; 1m: Matilda (+1034) dau.of Emperor Konrad II; 2m: 1043 Matilda de Frise (+1044) dau.of Mgve Liudolf of Friesland; 3m: Reims 29.1.1044/29.1.1050 (NOTE) Pss Anna Jaroslavna of Kiev (*1024 +1076)  D1. King PHILIPPE I of France (1060-1108) cr 1059, *1053, +Meulan 29.7.1108, bur Abbaye St.Benoit-sur-Loire; 1m: 1072 (repudiated 1092) Bertha of Holland (*ca 1055, +1094); 2m: 15.5.1092 (separated 1104) Bertrade de Montfort-l'Amaury (+14.2.1117)  E1. King LOUIS VI "le Gros" of France (1108-37) cr 1101, Cte de Vexin et de Vermandois, *IX-XI.1081, +Château Bethisy nr Paris 1.8.1137, bur St.Denis; 1m: 1104 (div 1107) Lucienne de Rochefort (*ca 1088 +after 1137); 2m: Paris IV/V.1115 Adélaïde of Savoy (*1092 +18.11.1154)  F1. [1m.] Isabelle, *ca 1105, +after 1175; m.before 1119 Guillaume de Vermandois, sn de Chaumont  F2. [2m.] Philippe, *29.8.1116, +from a fall from a horse in Paris 13.10.1131, cr King of France 1129  F3. [2m.] King LOUIS VII "le Jeune" of France (1137-80) cr 1131, Duc de Aquitaine (1137-80), *1120, +Paris 18.9.1180, bur Notre Dame, Barbeaux nr Fontainebleau; 1m: Bordeaux 22.7.1137 (div 1152) Aliénor d'Aquitaine (*1122 +31.3.1204); 2m: Orleans 1153/54 Constance of Castile (*1140 +4.10.1160); 3m: 13.11.1160 Alix de Blois (*1140 +4.6.1206)  G1. [1m:] Marie, *1145, +11.3.1198, bur Méaux; m.1164 Henri I de Blois, Cte de Champagne (*1126 +17.3.1181)  G2. [1m.] Alix de France, *1151, +after 1195; m.1164 Cte Thibaut IV de Blois (*ca 1130 +1191)  G3. [2m.] Marguerite, Cts de Vexin, *1158, +Acre 1197; 1m: 21.8.1172 Pr Henry of England, Duke of Normandy (*1155 +1183); 2m: 1186 King Bela III of Hungary (*1148 +23.4.1196)  G4. [2m.] Adélaïde, *1159, +1160  G5. [3m.] King PHILIPPE II AUGUSTE of France (1180-1223) cr 1179, *Gonesse 22.8.1165, +Mantes 14.7.1223, bur St.Denis; 1m: Bapaume 28.4.1180 Cts Isabelle d'Artois (*1170 +15.3.1190); 2m: 14.8.1193 (repudiated later that year, but remarried 1200) Ingeborg of Denmark (*1175 +1236); 3m: VI.1196 (repudiated 1200) Agnes von Andechs (+1201); for his descendants see HERE  G6. [3m.] Alix, Cts de Vexin, *1170, +after 1200/ 1218/21; m.Meudon 20.8.1195 Guillaume III Talvas, Cte de Ponthieu et de Montruil (*ca 1177 +1221)  G7. [3m.] Agnés=Anne, *1171, +1240; 1m: 1180 Alexios II Komnenos, Emperor of Byzantium (*1167 +1183); 2m: 1183 Andronikos I Komnenos, Emperor of Byzantium (*1110 +12.9.1185); 3m: 1204/05 Theodoros Branas, sn of Adrianople  G8. [illegitimate] Philippe de France, +1161  F4. [2m.] Henri, Bp of Beauvais, Archbishop of Rheims, *1121, +13.11.1175, bur Rheims  F5. [2m.] Hugues, *1123, +young  F6. [2m.] Robert I "le Grand", Cte de Dreux, du Perche et de Braine-sur-Vesle, *1123, +Braine 11.10.1188, bur there; 1m: 1139/41 Agnes (*1122 +1143), dau.of Anseau de Garlande, Cte de Rochefort; 2m: ca 1144 Hedwige (*1118 +1152) dau.of Gautier d'Evreux, Earl of Salisbury; 3m: 1152 Cts Agnes de Braine (*1130 +1202/18) dau.of Guy de Baudement, Cte de Braine; for his descendants see HERE  F7. [2m.] Philippe, Archbp of Paris, *1125, +4.9.1161, bur Notre-Dame, Paris  F8. [2m./by Adelaide de Maurienne (SS)] Pierre I, sn de Courtenay, de Tanlay, de Champignelles, etc, *1126, +Palestine 1179/10.4.1183; m.after 1150 Elizabeth, Dame de Courtenay (*ca 1135 +after 14.9.1205) dau.of Renaud de Courtenay; see HERE  F9. [2m.] Constance, *1124, +Rheims 16.8.1176; 1m: II.1140 Eustache IV de Blois, Cte de Boulogne (*1127 +10.8.1154); 2m: 1154 (div 1165/66) Cte Raimond V de Toulouse (*1134 +1194)  E2. [1m.] Henri, *1083, +young  E3. [1m.] Charles, Abbot of Charlieu, *1085, +young

E4. [1m.] Eudes, *1087, +1096 E5. [1m.] Constance, *1078, +I.1124/26; 1m: 1093/95 (div 1104) Hugues I de Blois, Cte de Troyes (+14.6.1126); 2m: Chartres 1106 Bohemund I de Hauteville, Pr of Antioch, Duke of Apulia (*ca 1054 +7.3.1111)  E6. [2m.] Philippe, Cte de Mantes, *1093, +after 1123/1129; m.1104 Elizabeth de Montlhéry (+after 3.3.1141)  E7. [2m.] Fleury, sn de Nagis, *ca 1093, +after 1118; m.N de Nagis, fl 1100  F1. Isabelle de Nagis, *ca 1118; m.ca 1136 Anseau de Venisy  E8. [2m.] Eustachie; m.Cte Jean d'Etampes  E9. [2m.] Cécile, *1097, +after 1145; 1m: 1106 Tancréde de Hauteville, Pr of Antioch (+1112); 2m: 1115 Pons de Toulouse, Ct of Tripoli (*1098 +1137)  E10. [illegitimate] Jacques  D2. Robert, *1055, +1060  D3. Hugues I "le Grand", Cte de Vermandois et de Valois, *1057, +Tarsus 18.10.1101, bur there; Leader of 1st Crusade; m.after 1067 Cts Adélaide de Vermandois et de Valois (*ca 1062 +1120/2/4) dau.of Cte Heribert IV; for his descendants see HERE  D4. Emma, *1054  C4. [3m.] Robert I "le Vieux", Duc de Bourgogne (1032-76), Cte d'Auxerre (1040-60), *1011, +Fleury-sur-Ouche 31.3.1076, bur Sémur; 1m: ca 1033 (repudiated 1046) Helie de Sémur, dau.of Damas de Sémur by Aramburge de Bourgogne (*ca 1016 +22.4.1055/22.4.1109); 2m: ca 1048 Ermengarde=Blanche d'Anjou (*ca 1018 +18.3.1076); for his issue see HERE  C5. [3m.] Eudes, *ca 1013, fl 1056, mentally retarded  C6. [3m.] Adelle, Cts d'Auxerre, *ca 1003, +after 1063; m.ca 1015 Cte Renaud I de Nevers (+29.5.1040)  C7. [3m.] Adélaide, Cts de Coutance, *1009, +Messine 8.1.1079, bur there; 1m: I.1027 Duke Richard III of Normandy (+1027); 2m: Paris 1028 Ct Baldwin V of Flanders (*ca 1012/13 +1.9.1067)  C8. [3m.] Constance; m. Manasses de Dammartin (+15.11.1037)  C9. [illegitimate] Raoul, Archbp of Bourges o B2. Adwige, *ca 969, +after 1013; 1m: ca 996 Ct Rainier IV de Hainaut (*950 +1013); 2m: Cte Hugues III de Dasbourg o B3. Giséle, Dame d'Abeville, *ca 970, +ca 1000; m.before 987 Hugues I de Montreuil, Cte de Ponthieu (*ca 970, +ca 4.7.1000) o B4. Adélaide, *ca 973, +after 1063 o B5. [illegitimate] Gauzlin, Archbp of Bourges, +1030 A2. Eudes, Duke of Lower Burgundy (956-965), *ca 944, +22/23.2.965; m.955 Luitgard de Vergy, dau.of Cte Gilbert d'Autun by Ermengarde, heiress of Lower Burgundy A3. Henri, Cte de Nevers, Duke of Lower Burgundy (965-1002), *ca 946, +Château Pouilly-sur-Saône 15.10.1002, bur St-Germain-d'Auxerre; 1m: ca 972 Gerberga (+986/91) dau.of Othon de Macôn; 2m: before VI.992 (div 996) Gersende, dau.of Duke Guillaume de Gascogne; 3m: 998 Matilda, dau.of Cte Lambert de Châlon o B1. [3m.] Aramburge de Bourgogne, *ca 999; m.ca 1015 Dalmas de Sémur o B2. [illegitimate] Eudes, Vcte de Beaune; m.before 1012 Inga N  C1. Aguion de Beaune, fl 1042  C2. Jean de Beaune, sn de Marcy, fl 1042 A4. Beatrix, *ca 939/940, +after 987/1005; m.954/5 Duke Frederick I of Upper Lorraine (*ca 912 +18.5.978) A5. Emma, *ca 943, +after 19.3.968; m.Duke Richard I of Normandy (*933/4 +22.11.996) A6. [illegitimate] Heribert, Bp of Auxerre, +964  

King PHILIPPE II AUGUSTE of France (1180-1223), *Gonesse 22.8.1165, +Mantes 14.7.1223, bur St.Denis; 1m: Bapaume 28.4.1180 Cts Isabelle d'Artois (*1170 +15.3.1190) dau.of Ct Baldwin VIII of Hainaut; 2m: 14.8.1193 (repudiated later that year, but remarried 1200) Ingeborg of Denmark (*1175 +1236); 3m: VI.1196 (repudiated 1200) Agnes von Andechs (+1201); He had issue:  A1. [1m.] King LOUIS VIII "le Lion" of France (1223-26), *Paris 3.9.1187, +Château de Montpensier-en-Auvergne 8.11.1226, bur St.Denis; m.nr Pont-Audemer, Normandy 23.5.1200 Blanca of Castile (*4.3.1188 +26/27.11.1252) o B1. Philippe, *1209, +1218, bur Notre Dame, Paris o B2. King LOUIS IX "Saint" of France (8.11.1226-1270), cr Reims 19.11.1226, canonized 15.8.1297, *Château de Poissy 25.4.1215, +k.a.Tunis 25.8.1270, bur St.Denis 22.5.1271; m.Sens 27.5.1234 Marguerite of Provence (*1221 +21.12.1295)  C1. Louis, *21.9.1243, +Paris bef 13.1.1259, bur Abbaye de Royaumont  C2. King PHILIPPE III "le Hardi" of France (25.8.1270-1285), cr Reims 15.8.1271, King of Navarre, Cte de Champagne at de Brie, *Poissy 1.5.1245, +Perpignan 5.10.1285, bur St.Denis 3.12.1285; 1m: Clermont-en-Auvergne 28.5.1262 Isabella of Aragon (*1247 +28.1.1271); 2m: Vincennes 27.8.1274 Marie of Brabant (*1256 +12.1.1321)  D1. Louis, *1265, +of poisoning 1276, bur St.Denis  D2. King PHILIPPE IV "le Bel" of France (6.1.1285-1314) and Navarre (1274-1305) =Felipe I, Cte de Champagne at de Brie, *Fontainebleau 1268, +there 29.11.1314, bur St.Denis 9.12.1314; m.Notre Dame, Paris 16.8.1284 Queen Juana I of Navarre (*14.1.1273 +2.4.1305)  E1. King LOUIS X "le Hutin" of France (1314-16) cr Reims 24.8.1315, King of Navarre (1305-16) =Luis I, cr Pamplona 1.10.1307, Cte de Champagne at de Brie, *4.10.1289, +Château du Bois-de-Vincennes 5.6.1316, bur St.Denis; 1m: Vernon-en-Normandie 21/23.9.1305 Marguerite de Bourgogne (*1290 +14.8.1315); 2m: Paris 19.8.1315 Clemence of Hungary (*II.1293 +12.10.1328)  F1. King JEAN I "le Posthume" of France and of Navarre, *Louvre 15.11.1316, +Louvre 19.11.1316, bur St.Denis  F2. Queen JEANNE II of Navarre (1328-49) =Juana II, *Château de Conflans 28.1.1311, +there 6.10.1349, bur St.Denis; m.Château de Conflans 27.3.1329 Cte Philippe III d'Evreux, King of Navarre (*1301 +1343)  F3. [illegitimate] Eudeline, Abbess of St.Marcel, Paris, *Paris 1305, +after 1330  E2. King PHILIPPE V "le Long" of France (6.1.1316-1322) and Navarre (1316-22) =Felipe II, Cte de Champagne at de Brie, Cte de Poitiers 1311, *1291, +Longchamps 3.1.1322, bur St.Denis; m.Corbeil I.1307 Cts Jeanne I d'Artois (*1291 +17.1.1329) dau.of Otto IV de Chalon, Cte de Bourgogne  F1. Philippe, *I.1313, +24.3.1321  F2. Louis, *IX.1315, +8.2.1316, bur Cordeliers, Paris  F3. Jeanne II, Cts d'Artois, Cts Palatine de Bourgogne, *1/2.5.1308, +13.8.1347, bur Abbaye de Fontenay; m.Nogent-sur-Seine 18.6.1318 Duc Eudes IV de Bourgogne (*1295 +1350)  F4. Marguerite, Comtesse de Bourgogne et Comtesse d'Artois, Dame de Salins (1361-82), *1309/10, +Paris 9.5.1382, bur St.Denis; m.21.7.1320 Ct Louis I of Flanders (*ca 1304 +26.8.1346)  F5. Isabelle, *1312, +1348; 1m: Fond-de-Dôle 17.5.1323 Guigues VIII de la Tour du Pin, Cte d'Albon et de Grenoble, Dauphin de Viennois (*1309 +28.7.1333); 2m: before 1336 Baron Jean III de Faucogney (+1345)  F6. Blanche, a nun at Longchamps, *1314, +there 26.4.1358, bur there  E3. King CHARLES IV "le Bel" of France (21.2.1322-28) and Navarre (1322-27) =Carlos I, Cte de Champagne at de Brie, Cte de La Marche 1314, *Clermont 1295, +Château du Bois-de-Vincennes 1.2.1327, bur St.Denis; 1m: 1306/07 (div 7.9.1322) Blanche de Bourgogne (*1295 +IV.1326); 2m: Paris 21.9.1322 Marie de Luxembourg (*1305 +26.3.1324) dau.of Emperor Heinrich VII; 3m: Brie Comte Robert 5.7.1325 Jeanne d'Evreux (*1310 +4.3.1370)  F1. Louis, *Issoudun 1324, +after christening a few days later, bur Montargis  F2. [1m.] Philippe de la Marche, *ca 5.1.1314, +ca 24.3.1322, bur Abbaye du Pont-aux-Dames, Crécy  F3. [1m.] Jeanne de la Marche, *1315, +17.5.1321, bur Maubuisson  F4. [3m.] Jeanne, *ca 11.5.1326, +ca 16.1.1327  F5. [3m.] Marie, *1327, +Paris 6.10.1341, bur St.Denis  F6. [3m.] Blanche, Cts de Beaumont, *Châteauneuf nr Orleans 1.4.1327/28, +Orleans 8.2.1392, bur St.Denis; m.18.1.1344 Duc Philippe d'Orleans (*1336 +1375)  E4. Robert, *1297, +St.Germain-en-Laye VIII.1308, bur St.Louis, Poissy  E5. Marguerite, *1288, +1300  E6. Blanche, *1290, +1294, bur St.Denis

Prince Pierre I de France, sn de Courtenay, de Tanlay, de Champignelles, etc, *1126, +Palestine 1179/10.4.1183 !dwid!; m.1150/55 Elizabeth de Joinville, Dame de Courtenay (*Courtenay 1127, +after 14.9.1205) dau.of Renaud de Courtenay; they had issue:  A1. Cte Pierre II de Courtenay 1193, Cte de Nevers, d'Auxerre et de Tonnerre 1184, Emperor of Constantinople (1216-19), Marquis de Namur, *1155, +Epirus after VI.1219; By his second marriage, he was called upon in 1217 to succeed to the Latin Empire of the Orient, created following the capture of Constantinople in the course of the Fourth Crusade. But on the way to his Empire, he was victim of a Greek ambush. Baudouin tried to engage the fief of Courtenay to Villehardouin, but King Louis IX objected. However, his son Philippe was able to engage to the Venetians. Later, through marriage, Courtenay was reunited with the Crown, after a possession by the King of Castile; 1m: 1184 Cts Agnes de Nevers, d'Auxerre et de Tonnerre (*1170 +1192) dau.of Cte Guy I de Nevers and Mathilde de Bourgogne; 2m: Soissons 1.7.1193 Mgvne Yolande of Namur (*1175 +1219) dau.of Ct Baldwin V of Flanders and Hainaut o B1. NOTE: There was a family called de Courtenay, seigneurs de Yerre, who descended from Jean I de Courtenay, sn de Yerre (+after 1221). Whether he was a member of this family has not been established; apparently there is no evidence one way or the other.
